results.title: A Kid called Troy
results.creator_credit: Terry Carlyon, Michael J. Rivette and Carlyon and Rivette Pictures
results.brief_description: A profoundly moving and inspirational sequel to the critically acclaimed “Suzi’s Story”. It is the story of Vince and Troy Lovegrove, the father and son who survived Suzi when she died from AIDS in 1987. Troy carried the AIDS virus from birth. This is Troy’s story - the story of what it is to be seven, to love life as only a child can and yet to be a victim of AIDS.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Terry Carlyon, Michael J. Rivette and Carlyon and Rivette Pictures

results.title: A Kibbutz
results.brief_description: Gives a brief history of the establishment of the kibbutz. Describes community organisation, and the changing role of women on the kibbutz. Shows the progress of a child through the system. Discussion ensues when two of the haberim wish to leave the kibbutz - problems and advantages are aired.

results.title: A Jury of her peers
results.brief_description: A farmer is found strangled in bed and his wife is accused of the murder. As the sheriff, prosecuting attorney and a neighbour search the farm for clues, their women, hardly leaving the kitchen, uncover the most crucial details about this shattered family…even the motive for the murder. Unknown to the men, they act as the accused woman’s sole jury - a true jury of her peers. Based on a short story written in 1917 by Susan Glaspell.

results.title: A Journey to freedom
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Helen Schloetzer
results.brief_description: Helen survived life in a German detention camp, her life was completely disrupted by the horror of war. Helen and her family were displaced persons when they migrated to Australia. Helen and her family found themselves transiting to Bonegilla, temporary accommodation for new migrants who had exchanged free or assisted passage to Australia.

results.title: A Journey to freedom
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Gia Binh Lieu and ACMI
results.brief_description: Escaping from Vietnam in 1988 to look for freedom, Gia Binh Lieu became a refugee and settled in Australia. His story is of family and disconnection, of survival and a better future.

results.title: A Journey to a new land
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Tuan Anh Tran and ACMI
results.brief_description: Leaving family and escaping from Vietnam in 1978 and eventually arriving in Australia by boat as a refugee, it would be six years before Tuan Anh Tran could finally be reunited with his family.

results.title: A Journey that wasn't
results.brief_description: A Journey that wasn’t is a colour video work that intersperses footage of an expedition to the Antarctic circle with shots of a concert held on an ice rink in Central Park, New York. Aside from a brief voice-over early in the film that provides a small amount of background information about the expedition, the rest of the work is not narrated.

Aside from a brief voice-over early in the film that provides a small amount of background information about the expedition, the rest of the work is not narrated.

Aside from a brief voice-over early in the film that provides a small amount of background information about the expedition, the rest of the work is not narrated.

results.title: A Jig: The River Cree
results.creator_credit: Thames and Clyde Film Company and Stanley Russell
results.brief_description: Introduction to a traditional Scottish dance the jig, set to the music of “The River Cree. Demonstrates the steps and movements of the four couples in a complete jig.
